chapter.title: Templates
chapter.para: The template specific elements which may be contained in the template description are as follows:

note.title: Element property icons
note.para: The icons used in the properties column of this table are described in

chapter.para:
Element Type Description Properties
type One of DESKTOP or SERVER The type of virtual machine the template provides
status One of ILLEGAL, LOCKED or OK The template status
creation_time xsd:dateTime format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss The date and time at which this template was created
origin One of RHEV, VMWARE or XEN The system from which this template originated
stateless boolean: true or false A stateless template has a snapshot of its disk image taken at boot and deleted at shutdown, meaning state changes will not persist after a reboot
memory integer The amount of memory allocated to the guest, in bytes
cpu complex The CPU topology (i.e. number of sockets and cores) available to the guest
display complex The display type (either VNC or SPICE), port, and the number of monitors
os boot dev="cdrom|hd|network" One of cdrom, hd or network A list of boot devices, described by a dev attribute on a boot element
os kernel string A path to a kernel image which the template is configured to boot from
os initrd string A path to an initrd image to be used with the kernel above
os cmdline string A kernel command line parameter string to be used with the kernel above
highly_available boolean: true or false true if the VM should be automatically restarted if the host crashes. A priority attribute controls the order in which VMs are re-started
cluster cluster resource A reference to the cluster on which an instance of this template will run. See
vm vm resource A reference to the VM on which this template is based. See
For example:

chapter.para: Templates also have a number of read-only device collections through which the devices attached to template may be queried. Like with VMs, there are cdroms, disks and nics collections. See .
There are two possible actions for templates - export and import.

section.title: Export Action
section.para: Export a template to an Export storage domain. A destination storage domain must be specified with a storage_domain reference. By default, the export action will overwrite any existing template by the same name in the destination domain, but this may be avoided by setting the exclusive parameter to true.

section.title: Import Action
section.para: Import a template from an Export storage domain. The destination cluster and storage domain must be specified via cluster and storage_domain references.

note.para: The import action is only available on templates listed under an Export storage domain. See .
